alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 7:13PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Phillips and west central Coahoma Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 713 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White River National Wildlife Refuge. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elaine, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Mellwood, Lambrook, Catron, Ratio and Lundell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
